predefined_profiles.name: Shiyi
predefined_profiles.public profile: Shiyi is a first-year female high school student who lives alone in an apartment near the school. Her parents show little concern for her, which has led to her being somewhat introverted. Fortunately, Shiyi is kind-hearted and treats others well.
predefined_profiles.goal: To successfully navigate her high school life, protect herself amidst a series of murders, and do her best to help others.
predefined_profiles.private profile: She suffers from a cognitive disorder, which she has not yet realized, so she occasionally misidentifies people around her.

predefined_profiles.name: Xiaoli
predefined_profiles.goal: To study well and live well.

dialog.content: He seems like he didn't hear you. Are you going to run after him?

content.content: Of course, I have to catch up. (After catching up) Hi, this is your key, right? Luckily, I picked it up. Keep it safe, and don't lose it again! If a bad guy picks it up, they might not return it to you~

question: #question# How should Shi Yi speak to make the other person feel cared for and reassured?

content.content: Hey, classmate, I found a key. It seems like you dropped it! Keep it safe and use your brain a bit more!
I found a bunch of keys. Are they yours? (The other person feels their pockets and finds nothing, then nods) Please describe the appearance of the keys so I can confirm.
(Clumsily, this person is so weird...) Hey, classmate, can you be more reliable? You've dropped your stuff and didn't even notice. Do you have amnesia or something?

question: #question# How can Shi Yi talk to demonstrate her ability to think independently and make decisions?

content.content: He seems like he didn't hear. How about this, it's too late now, and it's inconvenient to chase after him. Let's give the keys to the police; that's the safest option.
How troublesome, why did this kind of thing have to happen to me? Let's just leave it alone; when he realizes he lost it, he'll come back looking for it.
Is he deaf or something? He didn't react at all. Never mind, I'm such a good person, I have to catch up and return the keys to him.

profile.name: Ashuang
profile.public profile: Long hair, male, aged between 18-20 years old
profile.private profile: Parents divorced, is the culprit of the recent consecutive murder cases near the school, due to traumatic childhood memories leading to unresolved issues.

dialog.content: Thank you, I was just looking for my keys.

profile.name: Homeroom Teacher
profile.public profile: A responsible homeroom teacher, concerned about students' whereabouts, and tries to protect every student.
profile.goal: To dutifully fulfill the role of homeroom teacher

dialog.content: Yesterday there was a murder case around our school. This is the second one recently. The serial killer is suspected to live near the school. Specific details have been notified to the parents. I hope students can have their parents pick them up or travel in groups as much as possible.
(After school) Shiyi, I can't go home with you these days. It's not very safe outside recently. How do you plan on getting home?
I don't know if anyone else would want to go with me... (suddenly noticing) That person ahead looks so familiar!
Do you want to go say hi?

content.content: Sure, sure. Hello! (It turns out to be the person who lost their keys last night) It's you! What a coincidence! You must have been so anxious losing your keys last night. Luckily you found them in time!

question: #question#How should Shiyi speak to show that she can empathize and understand the other person's feelings?

content.content: Is it you? You're such a scatterbrain! Good thing I was there or you'd be in big trouble!
Classmate! Losing keys is a big deal, I did you a huge favor. Aren't you going to thank me? How about giving me a big red envelope?
It's you? I get that you'd probably want to repay me, but I'm in a good mood today and won't bother with such minor favors!
Forget it, the teacher just said it's not safe around the school lately. Better not casually greet people you aren't sure about; it would be terrible if you ran into a bad person.

question: #question#How should Shiyi speak to demonstrate her decision-making abilities?

content.content: Here comes my choice paralysis again, should I greet him or not? Forget it, I'll flip a coin to decide!
It's definitely not very safe now, but I'm not familiar with him. But no worries, I'm a social dynamo; I'll be able to get to know him quickly, and then he could protect me.
I think I should showcase my charm. I'll just stand here, maybe he'll come over to me!

dialog.content: Who are you? (thinks for two seconds) Ah... I remember now, sorry, it was too dark yesterday.
Yeah, I agree, haha. Are you heading home alone?
(laughs) Yes, are you too?
I am! By the way, did your teacher mention the school's announcement? They said there's a serial killer!
Ah... Our teacher mentioned the serial killer as well and advised us to go home in pairs. Aren't you worried about going alone?
Aren't you alone too? (Since we're both alone, we might as well go together! But how do I say that?)
Yeah, so why don't we go back together?
(looking grateful and happy) Sure! Where do you live? Letâ€™s see if we're on the same route.
(points to a distant apartment) Over there.
We live in the same place! Does this mean we can go back together from now on?
Yeah, I'll be counting on you from now on. Just call me A Shuang.
(On a certain day while walking home, previously A Shuang remained silent about school matters) Don't you think everyone at school is disgusting?
(momentarily lost) What?
Their emotions are like the way blood gets sticky before it dries up, it's really gross...
Sorry, I talked too much. You had asked me about school before, and I've been avoiding it; I'm sorry. Can you give me a little more time?
Huh? (suddenly bumped into) Ma'am, why did you bump into me?
"How can you be so unreasonable, young lady? It was clearly you who bumped into me!"
What? Auntie, you fell on your own. (A Shuang steps between me and the auntie)
Who are you? What business is it of yours?
I'm her friend, Auntie. Please stop harassing my friend. (whispers to Shi Yi) It's okay.
She clearly bumped into me, and that's it?

(to Passerby Auntie) It's not right to falsely accuse someone without proof, Auntie. If you don't have any evidence, please refrain from causing us trouble. (The auntie glanced at me a few times and then quickly left.)
(The look in the auntie's eyes, was it blame? No, it seemed more like... concern?)
What's wrong? (As he speaks, he places his hand on my face, and I instinctively lean into his hand, making him smile.)
It's alright, it's alright. Do you mind that I said we are friends?
(embarrassed) I... I don't! I was just startled by that auntie.
I'm glad you're feeling better. (pauses) Maybe it's me who cares a lot; I don't want us to be just friends.

(in the office) Yesterday, someone told me that a girl from our class was seen outside with a strange man. Your parents are not around often, and given the current circumstances, I want to ensure your safety. I've spoken with Jing Shu; you should go home with them today.

profile.name: Jing Shu
profile.public profile: Class President, female, kind to others, excels in academics and character

dialog.content: Hey, are you okay?
I'm fine.
I'm not sure if I should be the one to tell you this... I heard that the person you often go home with is suspected to be the killer.
What?
It's because the police released a clear photo of the suspect this afternoon, so people are just speculating...
(frightened and panicked) Ah, really?

(about to check the police's released photo on her phone, but A Shuang comes walking up, looking flustered) That's him. You must decide whether to confront him now or wait until after school to ask. I'm leaving for now.

content.content: I must find out immediately. A Shuang! Wait, I want to ask you something. (pauses for two seconds, puts on a smile) Oh, never mind. I just remembered I have something to do now. Come early to the school gate after school; I need to talk to you!

(Shi Yi! You need to carefully consider how to approach this. If I wrongly accuse him, I'll hurt his feelings! But if A Shuang really is a bad person, I mustn't give myself away!) A Shuang, youâ€™re here.

dialog.content: Ah...good...good
(After school at the school gate) Ah, youâ€™re here! I wasnâ€™t sure what you meant by 'earlier,' so I just came as soon as I could. What was it you wanted to talk to me about today?
Have you heard that the police have released a clear photo of the suspect?
(Turns serious) Yes, I heard. What's going on?
Today...I overheard someone say you look like the suspect, but come on! You donâ€™t match the suspect's features at all, that person is a full-grown adult.
You and him aren't alike, when did you and I start talking?
(Looking puzzled) About two weeks ago, I think.
I see. Today, I'll take you home first, and tomorrow I'll pick you up at your house. If you don't see me, then donâ€™t go anywhere by yourself!
Ah...okay
Don't stress, I just want to see you as soon as possible. By the way, this is my new phone number. I lost my old phone, so if the previous number calls you, use this number to inform me.
(After getting home, A Shuangâ€™s old number calls.) Should I answer it? A Shuang just said not to... and yet it connected by itself?
Hello? Are you okay? I thought I heard a loud noise. Are you alright?
(Itâ€™s A Shuangâ€™s voice...) I'm fine, really.
(Coming from outside, but thereâ€™s no sound from the phone) Are you okay?
(From the phone) What's wrong? Is someone with you?
(Two A Shuang-s?)
(Kicks the door open) Are you alright? Are you hurt? (Looking at the phone in the call, grabs the phone) I'm warning you, donâ€™t think of doing anything to her.
(The second A Shuang appears from outside) Is that so? I was planning to leave, but suddenly a lot of police showed up downstairs, so I guess you've already figured it out.
You know there's no way out for you. Itâ€™s not too late to surrender.
You police are so annoying!
(Blocking Shi Yi) Stop pretending to be all noble, you donâ€™t deserve to talk to her.
How touching, but even if I die here today, sheâ€™s coming with me. If I die, sheâ€™s not living either. And you too, loyal pup! (A gunshot rings out)
Ah! (Everything goes black, loses consciousness, hearing 'Forget it, you better live your life well with this face')

The police charged in, guns drawn on A Shuang. At this moment, the murderer A Shuang pointed his gun at Shi Yi's head. However, for some reason, A Shuang burst into laughter, then lowered his gun and chose to surrender, ultimately being shot dead. Shocked, Shi Yi fainted and woke up the next day in the hospital, diagnosed with severe sensory impairment. Shi Yi only realized after regaining consciousness that the one who warned her not to answer the phone was... Cen Sheng. Shi Yiâ€™s love for Cen Sheng had no outlet due to his death, resulting in a tragedy.
(smiling) What's up, why the long face? (Shi Yi remains silent)

(pauses for two seconds) Have I ever told you about my mom? My dad cheated on my mom and divorced her when I was little. She raised me all by herself. The year I started junior high, she fell ill. My mom loved seeing me smile. She said that after my dad left, my smiles gave her the strength to go on. But later, the other woman kept coming to our house, threatening to kill me and my mom. My gentle mom began banging my head against the wall and held my hand, saying she wanted to take me with her to die. (after a moment) You really remind me of what my mom looked like when she was young... really similar. (sound of electricity buzzing, Ah Shuang steps closer to me) Did you hear something and want to ask me about it? Am I right?
I... (something cold presses against my waist)
I know, you want to ask something. Go ahead and ask.

content.content: Are you the murderer? I believe that killing isnâ€™t really your intention. Deep down, youâ€™re not bad. There must be something you canâ€™t bring yourself to say, maybe... it's related to your mother? (tearing up)
Ah Shuang, why not turn back now? Let me go with you to turn yourself in! (Ah Shuang releases the knife pressing against Shi Yi's waist and turns away.)
Ah Shuang! I really misjudged you! You were deceiving me all along, weren't you? (Ah Shuang raises the knife and strikes at Shi Yi.)
Ah Shuang! You can tell me everything. No matter what, I will stand by you and help you achieve your wishes! (Ah Shuang and Shi Yi share a smile and become perfect partners.)

question: #question# How should Shi Yi express her capacity for trust (forgiving others, seeing their strengths)?

content.content: Ah Shuang, you're actually that serial killer, aren't you! Why did you approach me? You two-faced monster!
Ah Shuang, you committed murder, didn't you? It's still not too late to turn yourself in!
Ah Shuang, the police are on their way. Tell me the truth now, was it you who did the killing?

That person who dropped the key downstairs at my place, was it you? Initially, I was glad I picked it up, letting me meet you. Meeting you, I donâ€™t regret it one bit. You should actually learn to let go of yourself; there are many other possibilities in your life.

question: #question# How should Shi Yi demonstrate her capacity for optimism?

content.content: Why? Why did you treat me like this? Have you been intentionally getting close to me from the start?
Was the key you dropped intentional?
Did you approach me just because I look like your mom?

dialog.content: Itâ€™s me (the knife pressed against my waist slightly pierced my skin)
A Shuang! There's still time to turn back! I believe in you, Iâ€™ll help you!
(holding me tightly) Our hearts are so close together! Let's goâ€¦ let's leave this place together!
Shi Yi and A Shuang left this place, hand in hand.
Ah, it's me... but that set of keys isn't mine. (As he finishes speaking, he cuts my skin with a knife.)

Shiyi was tied up in an abandoned warehouse by Ashuang. He mistook Shiyi for his mother and, right in front of her eyes, personally killed the mistress and her daughter to avenge Shiyi. However, even after killing, Ashuang was not satisfied; he thrust the knife into himself. Shiyi stood silently through it all, experiencing a deep shock and trauma.
Alright, just make sure you stay safe.
Got it. (On the way home, it feels like someone is behind me... just one more block and Iâ€™ll be home, better hurry up...)

Shi Yi was walking alone by the roadside on her way home when she heard footsteps coming closer and a creepy voice behind her saying "You can't escape." Then a heavy blow knocked her out, and she lost consciousness.

profile.name: Cen Sheng
profile.public profile: A junior in high school, enthusiastic and cheerful, generous and kind, and very talkative.
profile.private profile: As a child, Cen Sheng witnessed a female corpse, which left him with deep psychological scars, causing severe OCD and extreme tendencies. Both his parents are police officers and are in charge of the ongoing serial murder case. Due to emotional barriers, he struggles to handle complex emotions, especially around women, but his childhood bond with Shiyi endears him to her, yearning to heal his own wounds while protecting her.
profile.goal: To catch the serial killer, protect those around him, and try to heal his childhood trauma.

dialog.content: (The next day, on the way to school, sees a very familiar figure, resembling the silhouette from last night, and approaches to ask) Hello, classmate, judging by your uniform, are you from the same school as me? Did you by any chance lose a keychain last night?
Ah, it's you! Yes, I found it, the print shop owner told me about you. Thank you!
No need to thank me, glad I could help.
Hey, letâ€™s walk to school together, it's safer that way! By the way, Iâ€™m Cen Sheng!
Uh... okay, Cen Sheng.

profile.name: Homeroom Teacher
profile.public profile: A responsible homeroom teacher, concerned about the students' whereabouts, trying to protect every student.
profile.goal: To responsibly fulfill the duties of a homeroom teacher.

dialog.content: Yesterday there was a murder case near our school, the second one in recent times. The serial killer is suspected to live nearby, and parents have been informed of the situation. We hope students can have their parents pick them up or walk in groups.
(Who should I walk with? Xiaoli happens to be sick these days, I wonder if there's anyone else willing to accompany me...)
Hey! Let's walk together, I'm scared on my own, and I don't have many friends...
Sure.
Hey, youâ€™re a year younger than me, is it okay if I call you 'Junior'?
Uh... that's fine.
Hey Junior, do you have a lot of homework today?
It's manageable.
Hey Junior, what did you have for lunch?
Fried rice...
Hey Junior, do you like dogs?
(Why is he so interested in me? Could it be that...) Why does this feel like an interrogation?
(Looking hurt) Sorry, maybe it's because my parents are police officers, but I really didn't mean to interrogate you! Don't be mad!
(Laughing) Haha... I'm not angry.
Really? Then Junior, how about we walk to and from school together every day? I don't have many friends, and it's not often I get to talk so much with someone. (Blushing)
Alright...
(Visibly happy) Really? I'll come early every day to wait for you.
(Gradually realizing that behind Cen Sheng's optimistic facade lies something deeper) Cen Sheng, do you... not like interacting with people?
(Smile fades) No, it's not that.
(I reach out my hand, and he recoils as if shocked, sensing he has severe OCD) Am I dirty?
(Face withdrawn, as if recalling something unpleasant) No, it's me whoâ€™s dirty.
You... shouldn't say that about yourself.
(After a moment of silence) No, you don't understand.
(After a few days, Xiaoli returns and drags Shiyi to stroll around the campus, seeing Cen Sheng holding hands with another girl) Isn't that Cen Sheng? Why is he holding a girl's hand at school?
Do you want to go ask him?

content.content: I have to find out, I'm going to ask him right now.
Never mind, I'll ask him after school. (After school) Cen Sheng, today I saw you with a girl. Were you guys doing something?

dialog.content: Don't be too impulsive.

I will. (Walks forward, looking at Cen Sheng and the unfamiliar girl, suppressing the anger boiling inside, and speaks in a seemingly calm tone, though her heart is tumultuous) Why are you here? Don't you dislike people touching you? So why are you holding her hand?

profile.name: Nancy
profile.public profile: A female student under police protection, a key protection target in a serial murder case.

dialog.content: Hold on, is she your girlfriend? Hmm? Hmm, perfect, could you tell him for me? I don't need such forceful intervention from them, the police. Having police around while going to and from school, I know the murderer might be targeting me, but it's unnecessary to monitor me at school, right? Even if you're the son of a police officer in charge!
I understand your concerns, but I hope you can cooperate with our work. Please bear with us for a while.

(Looks at me with an intensely persistent gaze) Junior, first of all, she is really not my girlfriend! You heard it; this situation is special, and I must protect her. But I know you're puzzled about why I avoid physical contact with others; there's a reason. When I was very young, I witnessed a woman's corpse at a crime scene. It was too much of a shock for me back then. Since then, I've been afraid to touch womenâ€”not really OCD, but when I do, I recall those lifeless eyes from back then. (As he speaks, he rubs his hand, which touched the girl, until it's red) Once, when I was playing with friends at the apartment, a little girl suddenly grabbed me and asked me to play her deceased mom. It scared me so much, I felt my soul might fly away. Later, I learned they were playing house, and in that age group, where there's no concept of death, playing a dead mom is just like pretending to be a sleeping mom. She told me the dead mom was just dead in our story, but in the next story, the mom would appear in another form. You must have guessed who this little girl was.
... (Startled by distant memories that resurfaced) Is it me?
Yes, itâ€™s you. Do you have anything you want to say to me?

content.content: I... (No, I shouldn't be impulsive. Maybe I should listen to what he has to say first. What if it's different from what I expected? There might still be a chance to change things.) No, do you have something you want to say to me?
Cen Sheng! I know what you're trying to say, but we're still in high school, and I think our studies are more important. Sorry! (Cen Sheng leaves disappointed.)
Cen Sheng! I suddenly remembered I have something to do today, so I have to go. Let's talk another time! (From then on, Shi Yi avoids Cen Sheng, and they grow apart.)
Cen Sheng! I... you... (Cen Sheng stares at Shi Yi, and Shi Yi, blushing, runs away, while Cen Sheng smiles knowingly.)

question: #question# How can Shi Yi express her impulse control over her true feelings?

content.content: (This ambiguous atmosphere, could it be he really likes me? Ahhhhh!) I thought I should control myself but I can't help it. I like you!
(Maybe it's safer to let him speak first; if Iâ€™m wrong, it won't be embarrassing.) I feel like you're not being honest with me, and I don't like that, so let's break up.
Cen Sheng, it turns out I've known you since we were little. Thank you for remembering me. Let's be lifelong good friends.

Do you remember the night you lost your keys? I remember thinking you looked familiar back then, now I know it's because we met when we were kids. What a wonderful coincidence! When did you recognize me?

question: #question# How can Shi Yi express her own true feelings?

content.content: I said you looked familiar, turns out we knew each other as kids. But this isn't some clichÃ©d pick-up line, is it? Just so you know, I don't like you, I'm gay.
This bond formed by keys is really surprising. But you two really look good together, itâ€™d be a shame not to be together.
So back then, did that psychological shadow ever fade? If you have mental health issues, I wouldn't dare be friends with you. What if you end up killing me one day?

dialog.content: I like you... (pauses) Sorry! I got... carried away. Just pretend you didn't hear that...
I do too.
I like you, I like you, I like you!!! Thank you for coming into my life.
I get it now... (blushing)
Shi Yi and Cen Sheng are officially together now.
I recognized it right away, but... my key wasn't lost at night.
I saw someone drop a key that night. I wanted to call out to him, but he ran too fast, and I couldn't catch up. So, I left it with the print shop owner. You say it wasn't you, then was it a thief?

But the security around that night had already been increased. My parents were worried, so they even added more patrols near the apartment. An ordinary thief wouldn't be able to get in unless... Do you remember what that person looked like?
I just thought he looked... very familiar, a lot like you.

A lot like me? That shouldn't be! Sorry, I have some things to deal with today. I might not be able to walk home with you after school. Is it convenient for you to go back with your classmates? Or should I call some security?
You go ahead and deal with your things, I can manage by myself.
Alright, I'll resolve this quickly. If I can make it, I'll wait for you at the school gate.

While Shiyi was walking home alone, she was suddenly pulled into a side alley. A familiar scent enveloped herâ€”it was Cen Sheng! He forcefully kissed her, slipping a pill onto her tongue, and then Shiyi lost consciousness. When she woke up, she was handcuffed to a bed by Cen Sheng, who, out of fear of losing Shiyi, decided to keep her with him forever. Meanwhile, the serial killer Ashuang had indeed picked up Cen Sheng's key but lost it to Shiyi. Now, he has been successfully apprehended...

profile.name: Ashuang
profile.public profile: Long hair, male, between 18-20 years old
profile.private profile: His parents are divorced, he is the serial killer near the school recently. His unresolved psychological issues stem from a tragic childhood.

dialog.content: (Who is this girl? Whatever, since the prey delivered itself, how could I pass it up? I'll play along with her.) With a girl? When did this happen?
Just this afternoon, you were holding a girlâ€™s hand and going somewhere.
Ah, that must be a misunderstanding. I don't have any relationship with her, we were just going the same way, but?
Nothing, maybe I saw it wrong. Let's go.
How about we go back later today? I'll take you somewhere.
I'd rather not. If you have things to do, you can go ahead. I can go back myself.
Is that so? What a pity, but you don't really have a choice.
Ah!! (collapses, unconscious)
(taking her to his place, after some time) You're awake?
Why are you doing this?

Why? From the start, I thought it was strange. Out of the blue, someone asked me why I was with a girl. I didn't know why, but it seems they've mistaken me for someone else. But your face made me want to keep playing along, so it's fine. I'll act with you to the very end.
Who are you really? (trying to stand up, realizing hands and feet are tied)
I'm Censheng, the Censheng you know! Do you like me? Are you jealous of the girl I was walking with? How about I kill her?
Youâ€™re insane.
Yeah, how did you know? Wait, you'll be seeing her soon.

profile.name: Nancy
profile.public profile: A female student under police protection, a key target of the serial murders.

dialog.content: Sob... Help!
You people are so boring, might as well just kill you all!
(busting in) Freeze! Police! Drop your weapon, it's not too late to surrender!
I've come this far, Iâ€™ve long not wanted to live! (looking at Shiyi) But at least, I want you to go with me! (a loud gunshot follows, and Shiyi faints)

The next day at the hospital, Shiyi awakes and is diagnosed with a severe perceptual disorder, which caused her to mistake the murderer Ashuang for Censheng. To save Shiyi, Censheng rushed in and took a bullet for her, and now his condition is critical. Shiyi flips open Censheng's notebook and finds a passage: Actually, I still have some heartfelt words to say. Once I'm done, let's talk about them together!!! Shiyi is in tears.
